etymologies: Middle English: from Old French varier or Latin variare, from varius ‘diverse’

definitions: differ in size, amount, degree, or nature from something else of the same general class
shortDefinitions: differ in size, amount, degree, or nature from something else of same general class

definitions: change from one condition, form, or state to another

examples.text: your skin's moisture content varies according to climatic conditions

shortDefinitions: change from one condition, form, or state to another

definitions: introduce modifications or changes into (something) so as to make it different or less uniform

examples.text: he tried to vary his diet

shortDefinitions: introduce modifications or changes into something so as to make it different or less uniform
